      static ThreadPoolExecutor newCachedThreadPool(int theThreadLimit, ThreadFactory theThreadFactory)
      Create a new ExecutorService, specifically a ThreadPoolExecutor, with the exact same configuration as Executors.newCachedThreadPool() with the exception that you can specify the maximum number of threads.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • newCachedThreadPool

        public static ThreadPoolExecutor newCachedThreadPool(int theThreadLimit,
                                                     ThreadFactory theThreadFactory)
        Create a new ExecutorService, specifically a ThreadPoolExecutor, with the exact same configuration as Executors.newCachedThreadPool() with the exception that you can specify the maximum number of threads. Because there is now a realistically finite limit placed on the # of threads, the rejection policy is changed from Abort to Caller Runs.
        Parameters:
        theThreadLimit - the maximum # of threads that can be in the pool at any given time
        theThreadFactory - thread factory to use
        Returns:
        the new cached thread pool

      • newBoundedCachedThreadPool

        public static ThreadPoolExecutor newBoundedCachedThreadPool(int theThreadLimit,
                                                            int theBounds,
                                                            ThreadFactory theThreadFactory)

        public static Executors2.CachedThreadPoolBuilder cachedThreadPoolBuilder()
